author: phil.eth
content:
Maybe its an coincidence but my lighthouse validators and teku validators started producing invalid attestations about 15mins ago.
LH:
``` 
Jun 30 16:00:21.026 CRIT Published attestation was invalid       type: unaggregated, slot: 7651, committee_index: 0, message: Invalid local attestation. Error: InvalidTarget { attestation: 0x652ba008138d8b1cc1852c1401e608a2123bd60995e2878215d2aa37daa7d630, local: 0xf9e3bd6d73cf6f7dbec50fd0e3eacf855e0bd1a40d2fdd87b38d5697e7460f4b } Detail: unaggregated attestation 0 was unable to be added to fork choice, service: attestation
Jun 30 16:00:23.001 INFO All validators active                   slot: 7651, epoch: 239, total_validators: 2, active_validators: 2, proposers: 0, service: notifier
Jun 30 16:00:25.001 CRIT Error during attestation routine        slot: 7651, committee_index: 0, error: "Failed to produce an aggregate attestation: DidNotSucceed { status: 404, body: \"No matching aggregate attestation for slot Slot(7651) is known in slot Ok(Slot(7651))\" }", service: attestation
```
Teku:
```
15:59:45.216 ERROR - Validator   *** Produced invalid attestation for slot 7648 with expected validator index: 72 and actual validator index: 1266 . Invalid reason: Signature is invalid```

author: phil.eth
content: <@!573787335796326400> Does teku log by default? If so, where are they stored?

author: butta
content: in other news , we now display the current state of the validator

author: benjaminion
content: <@311126836371259402> standard logs are in `~/.local/share/teku/logs` on linux (maybe the same on MacOS). You can change the log-level on the fly via the API, see https://pegasyseng.github.io/teku/#tag/Admin

author: Deleted User
content:
I think I found a usability bug with `altona.beaconcha.in`: if I open an URL such as this:
```
https://altona.beaconcha.in/dashboard?validators=128
```
and then I open a URL such as this in a separate tab:
```
https://altona.beaconcha.in/dashboard?validators=142
```
Then the URL of the first tab changes to `142` as well - state is shared between the 2 tabs in the browser

author: Deleted User
content: not sure if previously reported though

author: protolambda
content: That's not a bug, that's a feature üôà

author: Deleted User
content: wat : |   ==> why, how ))

author: protolambda
content: It remembers your dashboard, it's intended for users revisiting it

author: Deleted User
content: so everything is a tradeoff in life... it's surprising behavior - it could remember the last opened URL, but changing the urls of the other active tabs is not common UX

author: protolambda
content: Yea, I also like bookmarks with data better for looking up the validators. Still a neat dashboard

content: <@!573787335796326400> thanks, I shared the log in the github issue.

author: kudeta
content: prysm based docker-compose setup should anyone find useful. Runs eth1-goerli, prysm-beacon, prysm-valid and eth2stats.

author: kudeta
content:
I mount everything in /mnt/data (a separate SDD). You need to set an env variable: 
export EXTERNAL_IP=$(curl -s ident.me)

author: .paulharris
content: https://altona.beaconcha.in/validators/leaderboard not sure if anyone has mentioned the '1 year' calculation being the same as the 31 days calculation and 7 day calculation

author: jgm
content: It's past income, not a projection.  So because the chain has only been running for a few days those values will be the same.

content: ah right, so once we're up for 32 days it'll be more interesting üôÇ
